title.narrative: WB Multi Donor Trust Fund Balochistan, FATA &#38;#38; KPK

description.narrative: The World Bank's (WB) Multi Donor Trust Fund (MDTF) aims to reconstruct and rehabilitate conflict-affected provinces of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK), the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) and Balochistan. This funding will help the WB commence additional activities and scale-up existing activities. The Asian Development Bank, European Union, WB and United Nations developed a post conflict needs analysis (PCNA) which addressed immediate post-crisis needs and identified strategic and peace building priorities which address the drivers and root causes of conflict in KPK, FATA and Balochistan. The PCNA was prepared to produce a coherent strategy to deliver an agreed vision for the border region to be achieved within ten years. The total value of Australia's contribution is $21.5 million over 4 years, starting 2011-12.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
